title: COVID-19 Services & Information
description: All Cornell community members are expected take personal responsibility to comply with Cornell's COVID etiquette, including staying home and getting tested if you're ill or experiencing symptoms of COVID-19, and masking around others as appropriate to help prevent transmission of the virus. cleaned_text: All Cornell community members are expected take personal responsibility to comply with [Cornell's COVID etiquette](/services/covid-19-services/covid-etiquette), including staying home and getting tested if you're ill or experiencing symptoms of COVID-19, and masking around others as appropriate to help prevent transmission of the virus. Please see details below. Report a positive test result [Report your positive COVID test result](https://dailycheck.cornell.edu/sratest-redirect) to receive isolation instructions and academic accommodations. Learn more about [COVID isolation](/services/covid-19-services/covid-isolation). [607-255-5155](tel:6072555155) if you have questions or concerns about symptoms, you want to receive a COVID vaccination or booster, you want PCR testing, or you need to extend your COVID isolation period. (See [how to get a COVID vaccination or booster](/services/covid-19-services/covid-vaccination-prevention#vaccination) and [how to get a PCR test](/services/covid-19-services/covid-testing#PCR).) Requesting a copy of your COVID vaccination records Students seeking a copy of their previously submitted COVID vaccination records should send a secure message to our Immunization Requirements staff. Log in to [myCornellHealth](https://mycornellhealth.health.cornell.edu/) using your Cornell NetID and password, and go to Messages > New Message > Send a message or attachment to Immunization Requirements. Academic support If you test positive for COVID, be sure to [report your positive COVID test result](https://dailycheck.cornell.edu/sratest-redirect) to receive your five-day temporary academic accommodation notice to share with professors. Learn more about [communicating with professors and keeping up with coursework](/services/covid-19-services/covid-isolation#coursework). If you need additional support, contact your [college student services office](https://provost.cornell.edu/leadership/vp-undergrad-ed/advising-support/). Housing & dining support Visit our [COVID isolation](/services/covid-19-services/covid-isolation) webpage for information about how to safely isolate and get meals after testing positive for COVID. If you have additional questions about housing, please contact [campuslife@cornell.edu](mailto:campuslife@cornell.edu). If you have questions about dining, contact [dining@cornell.edu](mailto:dining@cornell.edu). Travel guidance - Review this [guidance from the CDC](https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/travelers/international-travel-during-covid19.html)about international travel to and from the United States. - Check any [entry and exit requirements](https://travel.state.gov/content/travel/en/traveladvisories/COVID-19-Country-Specific-Information.html)for all countries through which you will be traveling. ( [International SOS](https://www.internationalsos.com/MasterPortal/default.aspx?membnum=11BSCA827281&akey=7057005B-D768-445E-B98512098E270F11)(ISOS) is another reliable source for the latest information on travel restrictions and entrance/exit requirements. From the link, click the COVID-19 button on the left and then click on Travel Restrictions, Flight Operations and Screening.) - If you have additional questions about international travel, contact [intlsafety@cornell.edu](mailto:intlsafety@cornell.edu) - Prior to your flight, review your airline's guidance on masking requirements and verify which types of tests or other documentation are accepted for boarding. - International students: See [documents required for re-entry into the U.S](https://international.globallearning.cornell.edu/travel/travel-documents-students). - Testing information: - Cayuga Medical Center provides [pre-travel testing](https://cayugahealth.org/sampling-center/)and travel documents. PCR and antigen tests are available locally at retail locations.
